title: What is the Document Object Model (DOM)?
content: DOM is one kind of component of HTML documents that can modify dynamically using programming language like JavaScript.

title: How do you select an element from the DOM?
content: I select an element in different ways. If I need only for a specific document then I use getElementById. And if I need an array of documents then I use querySelectorAll(). Sometimes I use getElementsByClassName to modify some similar documents.

title: What is event delegation in the context of the DOM, and why is it useful?
content: Event delegation is a root event listener through which its child nodes can also listen for events using event.target. It is an optimization solution for large codebases or many event listeners.

title: How do you manipulate an element's attributes and styles using the DOM?
content: I manipulate an element's attributes using setAttribute('attributeName','value') and removeAttribute('attributeName'). I style the DOM using the 'style' keyword and properties like dom.style.color = 'green'.
